extra.enrollment_requirement:
Prerequisites    (PHYS212 and PHYS239) and (MATH221 or MATH280) and (MATH232 or MATH231).
Exclusions    No more than 3.0 units from  CISC271; MATH272; PHYS313.

basic.description: Introduction to Linux and a programming language. Foundations and limitations of numerical calculations. Code development, debugging, optimization and profiling. Algorithms and techniques used in physics problems. Possible topics to be covered include numerical differentiation and integration, root finding and optimization problems, solution of linear systems of equations, Monte Carlo simulations, symbolic computation.
basic.subject: PHYS
basic.title: Computational Methods in Physics
